description: Dagger and Knight both? Barriers and sentries are almost obsolete!

name: Combo draw Weyland
description: This is the actual deck I played at the Indy store champs, before the final version which is on the front page 4/6/14

name: CI Wins
HB Wins - Double Time
HB Wins(alt.) - Double Time
The NEXT Wall 2.0
description:
Adaptation of my earlier NEXT Wall deck. Found here: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2975/the-next-wall-v1-1

Biggest changes: Ice: I made a bigger difference between my types of ICE. Cheap Binairy ICE next to more expensive mid game ICE. I've mostly left out the really big players like Wotan and Janus, because building mutiple levels of cheaper ICE with different subtypes is IMO just a lot better. I'd like to exchange another Viper for a Rototurrent, but don't have the card for that. I'll have to borrow it sometime.

Agenda's: Big overhaul here. Project Wotan is fun and stuff (especially if you add 6 subroutines to a card), but 3/5 agenda's is just too much for this deck. Threw them out, loaded up on the Gila hands for econ. Switched Efficiency committee for NAPD contract to tax the runner. As a 2/4 agenda it proved to be more of a hassle than a true boon, might as well make the runner pay to let him score.

Assets and Operations: The previous deck was too basic. My econ was already quite big and cards like Successful Demonstration have a good turnover, but it sucks to have a condition on a econ card. Eve campaign was too slow for my tastes and with Gila Hands I could diversify my bag of tricks. Of course the most logical step would be more +1 click cards. Threw in 2x Biotic Labour and 2x Director Haas. Made the deck a lot faster. Once Haas is on the table and you've got SanSan in your hand, scoring agendas becomes cheap as chips.

I'm probably not going to change much to this deck until a few more expansions are out (unless somebody has a good suggestion). I'm still waiting for more NEXT ice. Probably going to play Jinteki for awhile once after the Chronos Protocol tour.

name: Kate - The best runs in life are free
description:
OVERVIEW This deck began life as an attempt to make Replicator useful. I decided on building a deck around the "Rec-Cred Hardware" - Lockpick, Silencer and Cyberfeeder. The Toolbox and Cloak had to go in, to play to the theme, and yge deck came to life.

ECONOMY 3x Sure Gamble 3x Armatige Codebusting Aesop's Pawnshop Many recurring credits.

Using Mac, the deck has very few major installation expenses - aside from The Toolbox, the worst it has is SMC into Gordian blade for 6cr. Runs are going to be cheap, if not free, with a full build offering me up to 14 rec-cr per turn to throw into them. Normally, I staple Magnum Opus into a shaper deck, but with the above in mind, I decided that Armatige would be enough. Aesop's went in to eat the Replicators and Inside Mans when I was finished with them (and give me that cheeky extra credit from Armatige, if need be).

CARD DRAW 3x Diesel 3x Replicator

Again, the deck is light. In theory, finding one Replicator will help thin the deck of the hardware I don't need, helping me draw cards that I do.

ICEBREAKERS Corroder Gordian Blade Dagger

I'm not 100% sure about this one. To play to the theme of the deck, I wanted icebreakers that can sit on Omni-Drive, which rules out Battering Ram. Only including one of each means I'm relying on SMC, and am vulnerable to damage - which is why Clone Chip went in. Deus X features, but mostly for its Net Damage protection.

SUPPORT 3x Inside Man 3x Clone Chip 3x R&D interface Levy AR Lab Access

Clone Chip has already been discussed briefly - but it also helps with multi-SMC uses, as well as helping shift icebreakers onto Omni-Drive. Inside Man I'm not sure of - while I have fist fulls of hardware to lay down, Mac is great at getting it done herself. At the very least, he's Aesop food. R&D Interface seems staple. Its hardware, and it helps me make minimal runs on R&D (potentially only needing a run every few turns), allowing me to more comfortably hit HQ or remotes.

FINAL THOUGHTS The deck may suffer against Net damage decks, or Weyland Cleaner decks - Plascrete carapace could go in (more hardware!). The lower scale icebreakers may suffer against heavier ice, but with so many Rec-Creds, it'll hopefully still be cheap on the "real' credit cost. I worry the economy is a little TOO light. Testing will tell.

name: Kate Cheap Deck
description: This deck has been working out pretty well all my runs are super cheap and with replicator things go down incredibly fast

name: Tennin Institute: How to Disappear Completely
description: A single-remote, off-the-grid never-advance deck that tries to make running as unappealing as possible to cash in on Tennin's free advancements.

name: Kate Imaginary Money
Tennin Institute: How to Disappear Completely v1.1
description: A single-remote, off-the-grid never-advance deck that tries to make running as unappealing as possible to cash in on Tennin's free advancements.

name: Bees in the Hot Tub
description:
Hb rush/FA type build, tries to score an early executive retreat or over advanced Vitruvius. Thereafter you can biotic your way to victory using FA and only icing centrals. At least that is the theory, this deck needs some work and I need more practice playing this type of deck. Comments criticisms welcome, I'd like to build my understanding of this archetype.

I was trying to run all operation Econ to speed things up as much as possible.

I spent a lot of time going back and forth on the ice mix, there is particular ice for different uses, etr on remotes, and then the bioroids are to create taxing centrals, however invariably in practice you need ice now! And you don't have the right type in hand so you end up with bioroids on your remotes and quandary on your centrals. Hive can be a monster early on a remote, also great on hq early against Gabriel.

Reclamation order is to keep the operation Econ going later so you can pull back two hedge funds to fund further biotic labours.

The June bug was a last minute addition, since sweeps week encourages people to keep fewer cards you can potentially catch them off card with the June bug.

Went 3-2 with it in a local tournament on Saturday.

name: Dinokit ver 1.03 4th at SC in Bydgoszcz 5/4/2014
description:
Stimhack burst economy together with yogosaurus-paintbrush credit free runs, supported by Imp's destructive power aim to allow you to dictate the flow of the game and end it before Corp will manage to set up proper defense.

Got a personal record during the tournament by trashing with my one and only Imp 8 cards during the first round and 10 during the last :D Scavengers for the win

name: Consistent Magic
description:
Consistent high money Whizzard deck, originally a siphon build, but I'm experimenting with dropping them to increase consistency. I like it, makes for fun games, seems to fit my play style well, but can't say I don't miss siphon.

Thoughts on it are that since dropping knight tollbooth has become a pain again, so knight probably needs to come back in, even if I only play it on tollbooths. Sharpshooter I like a lot, comes in really handy against archer, grim, and corporate troubleshooter. Lucky find is ok, may swap for aesops. Whizzard's ability seems really helpful and I tend to get at the very least a Jackson trash in every game. When you start powering through eves, San sans, and Adonis it's even more satisfying, but of course depends on the matchup.

Went 3-2 with it in a local tournament on Saturday.

name: Shutdown Whizzard
description:
This is the first deck I publish. I always liked Whizzard and Darwin, so tried to build a deck with them. The idea it’s pretty straight forward, trash the assets, try to keep the corp poor (in terms of economy and/or “tools”) with things like Emergency Shutdown, FAO, Vamp and Imp. Don’t try to put many counters on Darwin, with Ice Carver and Datasuckers, 3-4 virus should be enough. Use Corroder, Knight and/or Parasite for the other ices. E3 helps to break things with Darwin and Knight. You have Deja Vu to get back whatever you need, most frequently Parasites, Imp or Knights (even a well-timed Surge could help).

The main problem with this deck is that it only access one card at a time, so you need to run a lot. Be aggressive, be careful of traps and tags, you don’t have Plascrete or anything to protect yourself. Obviously isn’t the most competitive deck, but I find it fun as hell which is the main objective to me.

If you have any suggestion to improve it I will like to hear it, though I wouldn’t like to change the core of the deck.

Thanks for reading. And you know, run early, run often!

name: Urban Operator
description:
This is a fairly straight forward, "Shaper-esc" Reina deck. The plan is to get Djinn out FAST! That means the first SMC is earmarked for it. I then start to search up Datasuckers and hit the server with least resistance (i.e.: Nerve Agent, Medium or Archives). You can then cap this with Hermitage in later turns. The idea is the get to running fast and don't stop.

I use the Caïssa to help after purges that lock you out of centrals. Hopefully I can have keep a Clone Chip on the table for a quick Bishop or Knight retrieval for those devastating destroyer flips.

Money is the standard, with Katy, code busting and gambles. I like the Dirty Laundry's for sustaining runs and getting sucker tokens. I didn't include Liberated because I fine it to be a big tempo hit especially in the first few turns.

All and All It looks good to me. I haven't been able to test it too much. Please let me know what you think. I need to start winning a little again. I feel like i a getting worse instead of better. :)

name: Weyland DRT
Weyland DRT snares

name: Winter Soldier v0.1
Reddit Draft
I like big ice and I cannot lie (v1)
description:
First go at a simple plan.. Make some money and gather enough resources to keep throwing out the biggest nastiest ice around and let em try to break through. Throw in some efficiency and some cards to get the bigger ice's rezzed early and it could be a pain to get through.

Thoughts? It's only v1 and I am fairly new, so critique away.

name: NEXTER Design
description:
The current iteration of NEXT I am playing. Complete with a mixed suite of ICE (21) and Celebrity Gift (which I feel is somewhat iffy).

Fairly straight-forward corp deck, nice for casual play, but can be taken to tournament level play if necessary.

name: Even NEXTIER Design
description:
A potential prototype version of my current list. http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/3933/nexter-design Thinking about testing out Caprice in here, seems to play well with bioroids. Can always archive her out if she fails.

Beanstalk over GLC and Successful Demonstration in place of Celebrity Gifts.

Bit shaky at 20 ICE, but hey, let's see what happens. Comments/suggestions are certainly welcome.
